EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5)
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –49.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5)
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5)
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –47.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)
– Sink Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5)
  • Pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting the fast inserter drop (–11.5, –49.5) to the sink inserter pickup (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research with integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5)
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) connected to the boiler
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5) 
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (2.5, 27.5)
  • Note: The fluid pipeline intended to link the boiler to the steam engine remains unresolved due to persistent congestion

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5)
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)
– An electricity network via Small Electric Poles distributed over the area

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple Pipe Groups distributed across the map (e.g., around (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (–1.5, 21.5), etc.)
– A key Pipe Group linking the new Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)
– An unresolved pipeline connection toward the Steam Engine caused by congestion near the boiler’s lower connection at (2.5, 21.5)
   • Candidate orientations (RIGHT, UP, LEFT, DOWN) with varied spacings have not overcome the obstruction

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and resource integration.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking the output of mining/inserter setups
– An electricity network formed by Small Electric Poles and associated distribution links

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion Issues
  – Persistent congestion near the boiler’s lower connection point at (2.5, 21.5) prevents establishing the fluid link to the steam engine. To mitigate, reconfigure or relocate interfering pipe groups, employ underground pipelines or pipe-to-ground modules, and consider rerouting the connection to a less obstructed area.
• Inventory and Placement Verification
  – Ensure target placement areas are unobstructed before positioning entities and verify that sufficient fuel and resources are available.
• Power Supply Verification
  – Confirm that all electrical components (e.g., fast inserters, assembling machines) are properly connected to a functioning power network to avoid operational warnings.
